text: Returns 1 if the primitive specified by the primitive number is in the group specified by the string.
int inprimgroup(<geometry>, string groupname, int primnum)
When running in the context of a node (such as a wrangle SOP), this argument can be an integer representing the input number (starting at 0) to read the geometry from.
Alternatively, the argument can be a string specifying a geometry file (for example, a
) to read from. When running inside Houdini, this can be an
if the groups exists and the primitive is in the group, or
This can use ad-hoc groups, like

.  It matches the SOP
group naming convention, in particular that an empty string means all
primitives.

title: inprimgroup
summary: Returns 1 if the primitive specified by the primitive number is in the group specified by the string.
